ygData.msgSnippet: Funny story here...I spent quite a few levels in MM and never found a single spell component.  I guess when they made the zone, they forgot to program the mobs
ygData.messageBody:
Funny story here...I spent quite a few levels in MM and never found a single
spell component. I guess when they made the zone, they forgot to program
the mobs to randomely drop spell components. Head to just about any other
zone and kill level 24 + level mobs. *Any* mob that is 24 to 28 has a
chance to drop level 24 runes, you just have to keep killing them and hope
you get lucky. If you are looking for a particular rune, I suggest that you
head to a dungeon and every so often /auction that you are buying that rune.
The exception here is MM, don't go there for any spell components <G>.


>Im looking for mobs wich drop a 24 lv runes i have pased all mistmore lake
>and graveyard but i dont find ONE ..rune anyone know what mobs drop runes
>easy and wich zone i will go there at last to buy some?

1: that would be my guess.

3: I'm not certain, but I believe this is for enchanters. They put the
faded page into their research book all by it self and click combine, then
they get a normal page back out that they can use for spells. Or they fail
their research check and get 'your skills are not sufficient...' message.

4: Azia and Beza (I think) What happened here is when the big Z made the
spell researches, he forgot what words he used and accidently named the
words he used for different spells the same name. Later when he realized he
screwed up (read: got hundreds of email for irate players like myself
bitching at him), he decided just to add the 'Azia' for the lower level
spell and 'beza' for the higher one so you could tell the difference. A lot
of people thought the spell in the book was wrong because they got the
message, 'these items do not combine...', even when they put the correct
words in. The problem was that they were using the word from the wrong
spell, even though they had the same name. Hence the addition of the 'azia
and 'beza' identifiers.

To answer you question after that rambling diatribe: I think that the Azia
is for the lower level spell and the Beza is for higher...if you buy the
research book, or get an updated spell list from the web, It should tell you
for sure though.

Ma`ar, Innoruuk

"Hard work pays off later, Laziness pays off now"
